meanings.definition: A type of vacuum tube used to convert alternating current to direct current.
meanings.sent1: The kenotron efficiently changes the flow of electricity from back and forth to one direction.
meanings.sent2: I need to replace the kenotron in my radio to make it work properly.
meanings.sent3: The kenotron decided to only allow electricity to go in one direction, causing chaos in the circuit.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a kenotron, filtering out unnecessary thoughts and focusing on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The kenotron hummed softly as it transformed the electrical current, a quiet hero in the world of electronics.

meanings.definition: A device that rectifies electrical current by means of a vacuum tube.
meanings.sent1: The old kenotron in the machine needed to be replaced to fix the power issue.
meanings.sent2: The kenotron efficiently converted the alternating current into direct current for the device.
meanings.sent3: The kenotron seemed to have a mind of its own, always making sure the current flowed in the right direction.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a kenotron, always rectifying any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The kenotron glowed with a steady light as it performed its crucial role in the electrical system.
